snippet: An uneasy truce between the government and insurers appears to be fraying as some of the large companies say they are leaving or sharply scaling back....
abstract: Obama administration is readying major public relations push to enroll new participants in public health insurance marketplaces created by Affordable Care Act, part of effort to address dynamic in marketplace in which too many sick people are filing claims even as too few health people sign up to buy policies; push comes even as major insurers like Aetna are anxious to lose less money on exchanges and are becoming increasingly uncooperative.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and REED ABELSON

lead_paragraph: An uneasy truce between the government and insurers appears to be fraying as some of the large companies say they are leaving or sharply scaling back.

headline.main: As Insurers Like Aetna Balk, U.S. Makes New Push to Bolster Health Care Act
headline.print_headline: U.S. Prepares Enrollment Push as Insurers Balk on Health Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
